title: Amazon falls below Google-parent Alphabet into 4th place on list of most valuable U.S. companies
text: Shares of Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, -1.47% shed 2.9% in morning trading, in the wake of a disappointing third-quarter report and outlook, to wipe out about $25.6 billion from the e-commerce giant's market capitalization. That knocks Amazon's market cap down to $855.3 billion, below Google-parent Alphabet Inc.'s GOOGL, +0.34% GOOG, +0.30% market cap, into fourth place on the list of most valuable U.S. companies. Alphabet's stock rose 0.1% to lift the market cap to $873.6 billion. The companies remain well-behind second-place Microsoft Corp. MSFT, +0.57% at $1.073 trillion and first-place Apple Inc. AAPL, +0.71% at $1.104 trillion. Amazon shares have rallied 15.1% year to date, but have slipped 3.0% over the past 12 months, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.68% has gained 7.7% over the past year.
